content:
Is anyone here familiar with #who-smart-guidelines ?
I just glanced at it superficially, and would appreciate a short summary of background and goals. Anyone?
IPA is mentioned, see https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1tklkYEJAeSqvpOx8txEgEmeWRbiBm5QaQYh_qMtE7tQ/edit#slide=id.g10f2c6ab2ee_3_286.
@Bryn Rhodes @Derek Ritz

@Mikael Rinnetm채ki there is an overview from the WHO here: https://www.who.int/teams/digital-health-and-innovation/smart-guidelines, it is an approach to developing guidelines that includes computable representation as FHIR implementation guides to help streamline implementation.

Sorry to be slow replying, @Mikael Rinnetm채ki . Bryn and I made a super-short "explainer" video introduction a couple of years back when this initiative first launched. It can be found, here: https://vimeo.com/347427025.
